programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Determined to prove his innocence in a double-cross, Bob Lee Swagger is now in a high-tension race from every law enforcement agency in the US and a shadowy organization that wants him dead.

programme.title: Mile 22
programme.desc: CIA operative Silva and his team race against time, facing military, police, and gangs, to transport an intelligence asset 22 miles to safety in Southeast Asia.

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Determined to prove his innocence in a double-cross, Bob Lee Swagger is now in a high-tension race from every law enforcement agency in the US and a shadowy organization that wants him dead.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt, a secret agent, is framed for the deaths of his espionage team and attempts to flee government assassins after him. He races against the clock in order to discover the truth.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: The world's greatest spy, Ethan Hunt, returns and partners up with the beautiful Nyah Hall to stop renegade agent Sean Ambrose from releasing a new kind of terror on an unsuspecting world.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt hurdles into spectacular new adventures from Rome to Shanghai as he races to rescue a captured agent and stop Davian from eliminating his next target, Ethanâ€™s wife.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Agent Ethan Hunt and his elite team go underground after a bombing implicates them as terrorists. While trying to clear their name, the team uncovers a plot to start a nuclear war.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: The Earth hurtles through space protected by an invisible force field, known as a magnetosphere.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Planet Makers
programme.desc: From the beginnings of our solar system 4.5 billions years ago, there remain many clues to reveal its evolution. Remnant debris, asteroids, and comets are what's left of the building blocks to our celestial neighborhood.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Edge of the Universe
programme.desc: The night sky is a time machine. The further we look out into the universe, the further back in time we reach. Most of what we see is actually dark matter and dark energy, but its nature eludes us ... for the moment.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Edge of the Universe
programme.desc: The night sky is a time machine. The further we look out into the universe, the further back in time we reach. Most of what we see is actually dark matter and dark energy, but its nature eludes us ... for the moment.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Mars: Adapt or Leave
programme.desc: Air, water, food, electricity and fuel all the essentials to explore the solar system, this episode explores the innovative plans for astronauts to grow their own food and extract water and fuel at their destinations.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Juno, Cassini and Beyond
programme.desc: The Amazing Cassini spacecraft and its sibling lander, Huygens, have now concluded their scientific studies, bringing back years of data. Now, Juno piercing the cloak of Jupiter and her distant relative New Horizons at the edge of the solar system.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Invasion Mars
programme.desc: For over 50 years we have bombarded Mars with our probes and landers. Spying from orbit to map terrain, finding her strengths and weaknesses. The time nearing for the full scale invasion of the planet- when humans walk on Mars and claim it for their own.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Planet Makers
programme.desc: From the beginnings of our solar system 4.5 billions years ago, there remain many clues to reveal its evolution. Remnant debris, asteroids, and comets are what's left of the building blocks to our celestial neighborhood.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Gas Giants
programme.desc: In the cold, dark expanse of our solar system, beyond the asteroid belt, lie the giant planets. Some can be seen with the naked eye, others have been visited by our camera. What secrets do they hold?

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Night Fire
programme.desc: The Northern Lights are more than just beautiful; they tell us about the make up of our planet, our sun, and may even be a signpost for the possibility of life on other planets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Virtual Universe
programme.desc: Our understanding of the cosmos is limited by the amount of time we have to see it. Fortunately, computer simulations can help us see how galaxies interact over millions of years, and even how dark matter structures the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Stargazer's Paradise
programme.desc: The Atacama desert is a perfect place for watching the night sky. With still winds and only a handful of cloudy nights each year, it allows scientists to get the absolute most out of their tools.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Hubble's Renaissance
programme.desc: Before we can reach space, we must first be able to see it. Hundreds of years ago, the simple telescope was used to give us a seemingly closer vantage. Today, we use the awe-inspiring, and super powerful, Hubble Space Telescope.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Superscopes
programme.desc: Discover the most powerful telescopes on the planet as they search for the mysteries of the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rainbow
programme.desc: The human eye can only see visible light, a small spectrum of electromagnetic waves. Today, we have instruments that let us perceive all wavelengths.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Seasons of Saturn
programme.desc: Saturn is the second largest planet and has an astonishing 60 moons in its orbit. Thanks to the Cassini mission, itâ€™s also one of the most studied and most photographed planets in our neighborhood.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Vesta Unveiled
programme.desc: With the Dawn missions exploration of the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres, asteroids are a hot topic. See what these incredible missions have uncovered.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Water Worlds
programme.desc: They key ingredient to life in the universe is water. Until recently we thought Earth was the only place in the solar system to have any water at all. Now that probes are peering around nearby worlds we are finding that is just not the case.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity has long been a force that has intrigued scientists. Now, for the first time scientists are probing to detect gravity waves in space as well as mapping the gravity patterns of the moon.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Science and the Shuttle
programme.desc: For more than 25 years the shuttle was our ticket to space, and our laboratory in orbit. Uncover the legacy of this amazing machine, and see what lies ahead.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Milky Way
programme.desc: This episode traces our view of the Milky Way, from the mythology of ancient skywatchers to the efforts of scientists to map it from the inside out.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Big Bang
programme.desc: When it comes to the birth of the universe, not even the most creative work of imagination can rival what science has revealed about the Big Bang.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Hot Zone
programme.desc: Mercury is one of Earth's closest neighbors, but until very recent exploratory missions, it eluded astronomers' best efforts to learn its secrets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rays
programme.desc: Cosmic rays can tell us much about the universe. They are not simply another form of light, but carriers of information about powerful and unseen processes at work thousands or even millions of light years away.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Fermi Paradox
programme.desc: The Fermi Paradox asks the ultimate question: why have alien civilizations not presented themselves?

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landsat
programme.desc: An advanced $900 million planetary explorer designed to peer across multiple wavelengths to reveal intricate details undetectable by the human eye.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Eye of the Beholder
programme.desc: The night sky has always been a source of wonder and mystery. In the quest to explore the universe, our greatest ally is the Hubble telescope.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Painted By Light
programme.desc: When the universe formed, all of space blazed white-hot, but it didn't last. Darkness reined for 200 million years before the light was reborn.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Colour
programme.desc: Color is essential to both art and astronomy. When measured, it can tell us the temperature, chemical composition, and motion of astronomical objects.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Perspective
programme.desc: For most of human history, the night sky seemed two-dimensional. To our ancestors, this perspective gave no hint to the universe's true depth.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Pioneering breakthroughs from across the globe shape the ability to travel.

programme.title: Caddyshack
programme.desc: It's the snobs against the slobs! While caddy Danny tries to impress elitist Judge Smails, a crude construction tycoon tries getting accepted at the country club, and a groundskeeper stalks a gopher.

programme.title: Instant Family
programme.desc: A couple find themselves in over their heads when they foster three children

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: A diamond heist gone haywire launches gangsters, bookies, and a dog on a rollicking ride through the rugged world of bare-knuckle boxing in search of the missing stone. Critically acclaimed comedy from Guy Richie.

programme.title: Hollywood Homicide
programme.desc: A pair of detectives investigate a murder while pursuing their other full-time professions. Welcome to Hollywood Homicide - the only place where you can come to work hungry, horny, thirsty, and broke, and resolve all four by the end of the watch.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: A US West Coast teen lifestyle parody centered around Cher, a popular high school girl who spends her days playing match-maker, helping her friends with fashion choices, and looking for a boyfriend.

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: Jerry Maguire is a sports agent who is brought to a point of crisis in his life when he decides to become an honorable man. Follow his journey to redemption through an unlikely alliance with a female accountant, and his least important client.

programme.title: Doc Hollywood

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: On a hot summer's day, life doesn't get much better than a big, juicy, smoky slab of spicy, mouth-watering ribs. Our goal was to produce flavorful, juicy, tender ribs that would be well worth the time, money, and effort.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Purchase a good steak and cook it properly, and all it needs is salt and pepperâ€”and, of course, a side of spuds. We wanted potatoes with perfect texture and big flavorâ€”something unusual to accompany a great steak and a good bottle of wine.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Few recipes deliver so much pleasure for so little work as pancakes. The batter comes together in minutes, and the cooking time is brief. Why, then, do most Americans never make pancakes from scratch?

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Huge meaty flavorâ€”combined with spice, smoke, and fireâ€”epitomizes Texas barbecue. Could we figure out how to make authentic Texas beef ribs in our Boston-based test kitchen?

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: What's for Sunday dinner? Around many American tables, it's meat and potatoes. Beef brisket is a good choice and a nice change from pot roast or beef stew. Although inexpensive and simple to prepare, brisket does pose some challenges to the cook.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We develop a foolproof preparation for pork chops with vinegar and peppersâ€”a modern version tangy and juicy enough to rival that prepared by an Italian grandmother. Next, we turn to pan-roasted pork tenderloin.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to develop a hassle-free pizza recipe especially for the grillâ€”one we hope will become a new backyard barbecue favorite.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to develop a recipe for pulled pork that rivals that of the best barbecue joints but won't be an all-day affair. We pair the pork with another barbecue classicâ€”cornbread.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: A visit to The Old Mart Resource Centre in Maud, Aberdeenshire, on the former site of one of the U.K.'s biggest cattle markets.

programme.title: Flour Power
programme.desc: At Live Language in Glasglow, one of Scotland's busiest language schools, it is a multilingual affair as Ruba, Tatiana, Nana, and Marcus battle it out for the Flour Power trophy.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The series starts in autumnal Bordeaux. Rick arrives just in time to judge a local wine contest, and hires a 2CV for an excursion to the coast - abundant with mussels and oysters.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein enjoys a winter break in Reykjavik in search of the perfect cod and sampling succulent fjord-reared roast lamb.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick enjoys a weekend in Berlin, where history and the avant garde dwell enticingly side by side. A city that once made history with its divisive wall teems today with an overwhelming array of innovative chefs offering delicious seasonal creations.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Vienna, the city that once ran the Austro-Hungarian Empire. It is home to comfort dishes like tafelspitz and goulash, and it also gave its name to one of Europe's most popular dishes, the wiener schnitzel.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits Bologna in northern Italy, a city so famous for its food that it's known as the stomach of Italy. He learns how to make the local fresh egg pasta used for tortellini, tagliatelle, ravioli and lasagne.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein visits Lisbon on the banks of the River Tagus, a city in love with its seafood and possibly the best custard tarts in the world. The culinary effects of Portugal's historic explorations are still seen in its dishes.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits the home of New Nordic cuisine, Copenhagen, where ground-breaking chefs create artful dishes and religiously stick to seasonal Danish ingredients. Rick goes foraging for rosehip and learns about the art of pickling buds, bark and flowers.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein heads to southern Spain and the historic city of Cadiz, where the narrow winding streets captivate him as he walks in the footsteps of the ancient Phoenician and Arab traders whose influence on the city can still be seen today.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick visits the north-eastern Greek city of Thessaloniki.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Rick Stein's long weekends across Europe come to a conclusion in the city of Palermo.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Road to Mexico
programme.desc: Rick enjoys sitting on the dock of the bay in San Francisco, tasting legendary dishes like the hangtown fry; San Francisco is also the home of sourdough and where America's love affair with seasonal cooking took hold.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Competing in this heat are: Apex, Vulture, Terrorhurtz, Track-Tion, Bucky the Robot and Rapid. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The fourth heat features an experienced roboteer fighting to secure his legacy, a new wave spinner and a powerful crusher. Competing through group battles for a place in the final are Iron-Awe 6, The Kegs, Tauron, Nuts 2, Concussion and Androne 4000.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This round determines which of the fighting machines makes it into the grand final, along with the final two robots to compete in the Ten Robot Rumble. Thor, Coyote, Expulsion, Hobgoblin, Push to Exit and Magnetar battle it out.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The illustrious grand final begins with the biggest battle in Robot Wars history. The second and third place robots from the heats will battle it out in a fight to the death to determine who will be the 6th and final robot in the grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Eight teams made up of families and friends from across the country put their homemade robots to the test inside a purpose-built arena, packed with arena hazards and four House Robots. The winner at the end will go forward to the grand-final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The huge axe of Robot Thor driven by Jason, a builder from Northampton, clashes with father-and-son team Will and Ian from Team Shockwave. A consultant cardiologist and his two sons cause a huge upset with their brand new untested robot.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: An eclectic collection of homemade robots including Glitterbomb, designed by nine-year-old April, which comes complete with a huge pink axe. A team of students from Falkirk bring a robot made of wood with a petrol engine.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Former holiday camp bluecoats enter the competition with their `launcher' Apollo. Father and-son-team Kan-Opener have a robot with huge piercing claws. A team of engineering students have created a future tech machine called Sweeney Todd.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Featuring one of the most bizarre, but certainly the tallest robot ever seen on `Robot Wars', Gabriel, built by Mensa member Craig and his three sons. It has wheels as tall as a washing machine and a huge samurai sword.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Winner robots from rounds one through five battle it out in the arena, a wild card from the runners up throws a spanner in the works as it tries to overthrow attempts at glory.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: New presenter Craig Charles joins Philippa Forrester to launch the second tournament.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: A robot attempts to use a self-righting mechanism to save itself from defeat, while another robot finds itself unexpectedly in the Pit of Oblivion.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Two newcomers head into battle, alongside the return of second seed Mortis.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Razer and Behemoth enter the competition for the first time.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Spin Doctor, the original thwackbot, and its famous Trial run, faces off against house robot Matilda.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Panic Attack, driven by Robot Wars legend Kim Davies, makes its entrance into the competition.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: New house robot The Sentinel arrives to face off against Nemesis and Roadblock.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: It's the debut of the famous Team Firestorm, with their Groundhog machine.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: King Buxton and Team 101 enter the competition and mark the beginning of their rivalry.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: A fierce battle to determine the final set of semi-finalists.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Two of the most famous roboteers make their debuts - Roger Plant, the captain of team Big Cheese, and Nick Adams, the captain of The Adams Family.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: More robots go into battle, with only a pair of 12V batteries to power them.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: In the first semi-final, the remaining robots have to pair off and fight to the death.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The Gauntlet makes its final appearance in the second semi-final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Four survivors come together in the ultimate home-made robotic showdown - and only one of them can claim victory.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Oxtail; slow-roasted beef ribs; cowboy steak; Korean short rib kebabs.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Arabian Gulf pot pie; braised lamb shanks with okra; curried swordfish stew; red lentil vegetable stew.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Peach crumble pie; key lime pie baked in a graham cracker crust; coconut cream pie.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Four cupcake recipes; blueberry swirl, lemon meringue, red velvet with cream cheese frosting and one-bite double diablo.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Giant bran muffins filled with raisins; citrusy mini orange muffins; healthy morning muffins; plum-filled coffee cake muffins; glazed zucchini muffins.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Orange chiffon cake; Shaker lemon pie; lime squares with pistachio graham cracker crust; upside-down cake made with three kinds of citrus.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Cranberry tart with currant jelly and cognac; mini chocolate whoopie pies; New York crumb cake; babka.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Pumpkin pecan pie; cheesecake swirled with pumpkin; pumpkin bread; deep dish pumpkin pie.

programme.title: Martha Bakes

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Pink applesauce-filled tart; pistachio brown butter cake with Concord grapes; pear frangipane tart; individual apple pies.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha shares techniques for making the perfect burgers; Pat LaFrieda joins Martha to grind his beef mix; Thomas Joseph joins to make a hake fish burger and Martha shares her turkey burger.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha is throwing a very special BBQ called Asado; plus Martha prepares a chimichurri sauce, her daughter Alexis's chopped salad and for dessert, fruit flavored popsicles; a perfect celebration.
programme.sub-title: Martha Throws an Argentine Asado BBQ

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: One of Martha's favorite things to do is to make jam with the perfectly ripened fruit and berries grown on her Bedford farm; Martha shares her favorite recipes, as well as jam and jarring techniques.
programme.sub-title: The Perfect Jams to Pair With a Simple Breakfast

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Meet Martha in one of her favorite places on the farm - the chicken coop to talk about one of her favorite things to eat - eggs; Martha will share her top methods for making an egg-cellent breakfast.
programme.sub-title: How to Properly Cook an Egg

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Tonight is pasta night in Bedford; Martha and friends make three pasta dishes, including a recipe from her new restaurant, The Bedford, a no-knife spaghetti, and a lemon angel hair pasta.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha takes shellfish to the next level with sustainable oysters, baked stuffed clams and more.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha's new passion project is the maze she's building on her Bedford farm; she shares her plans and inspiration for the project and teaches the proper measuring, staking and fertilizing techniques to properly plant successful trees.
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha shows how to properly move an established tree on her very own Christmas tree farm; she gives a tour of her pinetum where she teaches about new and unusual conifer trees.
programme.sub-title: Everything You Need To Know About Conifers

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha brings the outdoors inside the home and shares her love of houseplants; she shows how to take care of the most popular houseplants and how to propagate them to create new plants.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha explores how to care for succulents including watering, fertilizing, and repotting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha takes us inside her vegetable greenhouse to see how she has turned her harvest into a year-round bounty; she collects, stores, and sows seeds, and makes her perfect green drink.
programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Recipes and household hints promote stylish living.

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Flank steak with parsley-garlic sauce; Father's Day; button-down Father's Day card; lunch box shoe-shine kit; Father's Day barbecue sauce; making and painting decoys; custard-filled corn bread.

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Baseball-themed show: oiling a baseball glove; cupcakes; baseball-trivia game; birthday table-setting; submarine sandwich; cotton candy; climbing roses.
programme.sub-title: Baseball Party: Grand Slam Cupcakes; Submarine Sandwich

programme.title: Martha Stewart Living
programme.desc: Picnic sandwich; chocolate cupcake cones; terry-cloth pillow; roses.
programme.sub-title: Pressed Picnic Sandwich; Chocolate Cupcake Cones

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha creates the perfect menu for a paella party that will have your guests coming back for seconds; her paella is served with gazpacho and her incredible sangria.

programme.title: Wicked City
programme.desc: A secret police force known as the Black Guard protects the boundary between the human world and the demon world.

programme.title: Demon City Shinjuku
programme.desc: A young warrior battles against a city overtaken by demons, one devil at a time. To save Tokyo from evil, he must defeat a sinister psychic from the underworld.

programme.title: Hunter x Hunter: Phantom Rouge
programme.desc: Someone has stolen Kurapika's eyes! Gon and Killua investigate, but the Phantom Troupe is back!

programme.title: Hunter x Hunter: The Last Mission
programme.desc: The Battle Olympia begins! Gon and team attend, but The Shadow puts a deadly end to the festivities!

programme.title: Kimagure Orange Road: I Want to Return to That Day
programme.desc: As college nears, Kyosuke and Madoka finally end up revealing their feelings to eachother, but how will Hikaru react when she's told, and can things between the three of them ever be the same?

programme.title: A Wind Named Amnesia
programme.desc: In this anime classic, a powerful wind has left all memories erased. Two years later, a young man travels on a journey to find the truth about the apocalyptic wind.

programme.title: Poupelle Of Chimney Town
programme.desc: What is the secret of the town covered in smoke, where everyone has forgotten to look up? This is the story of a young boy and a man made of garbage who look for "stars".

programme.title: Blue Thermal
programme.desc: Tamaki becomes a captive of the vast beauty of the skies from the moment Kuramochi takes her under his wing and up for a flight in a glider.

programme.title: Giovanni's Island [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A dramatic yet heart-warming story of cross-cultural friendship among children in the aftermath of WWII, presented by Tokyo-based award-winning animation studio Production I.G. Based on true events.

programme.title: The Silver Brumby
programme.desc: In the unforgiving wilderness of the Australian Alps, there roams a stallion like no other, the Silver Brumby. Now, one horseman sets off on an unforgettable adventure to capture the horse that according to legend, could never be tamed.

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried co-star in this sci-fi thriller set in a future world where aging stops at 25, and the only way for one man to stay alive is to steal more time.

programme.title: Cybermutt
programme.desc: The powerful dog Rex is injured by a car while rescuing a young scientist from being run over. Feeling responsible for the condition of Rex the scientist uses his skill as a prosthetics inventor to give the dog a new, super-power body.

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: A crew of miniature aliens operate a spaceship that has a human form

programme.desc: A former thief frantically searches for his missing daughter, who has been kidnapped and locked in the trunk of a taxi. Starring Nicolas Cage and Malin Akerman.

programme.title: Grace and Goliath
programme.desc: Hollywood big-shot Josh Jenkins sweeps into Belfast to make a movie, but before long his world crashes and he loses everything. Hotel cleaner Lily invites him to stay with her family and gradually the people of this 'strange' city touch his heart forever.

programme.title: Windstorm
programme.desc: Rebel teen Mika encounters a beautiful, wild stallion named Windstorm at her grandmother's riding school and learns she can communicate with horses.

programme.title: Switched
programme.desc: Tired of being bullied, Cassandra Evans prays that her nemesis, Katie Sharp, the queen bee of social media, would know what it's like to walk a day in her shoes. Her prayer is answered in an unexpected way when they get "Switched."

programme.title: The Sorcerer's Apprentice
programme.desc: Ben Clark yearns to learn magic from his new neighbor, Milner. Milner hesitates to help Ben because he carries the same scar as the original bearer of an ancient staff that was wielded in the battle between good and evil 1,400 years ago.

programme.title: Mail Order Monster
programme.desc: A girl seeks help and guidance from a robot monster to cope with the bullies at school and her father's new girlfriend.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
programme.desc: One of puppet-maker Geppetto's creations, a puppet called Pinocchio, magically comes to life. In order to become a real boy, Pinocchio must go on a daring adventure and learn valuable lessons.

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: Experience the magical world of 'The Secret Garden' as never before in this beautiful production of the classic tale. When her parents are lost in a tragic accident, Mary must seek comfort in the strange and forgotten corridors of Misselthwaite Factory.

programme.title: Slow Moe
programme.desc: When struggling baseball player Marvin finds a pair of glasses that transform him into a star player, he thinks he can't win without the glasses. But when they disappear, Marvin's teammates help him realize winning doesn't mean anything.

programme.title: Wish Upon a Star: Wish Upon a Star
programme.desc: In this cult classic, younger sister Hayley Wheaton (Danielle Harris) wishes to switch places with her popular older sister Alexia (Katherine Heigl) and the two bickering siblings awaken to find the wish has come true.

programme.title: Pudsey The Dog: The Movie
programme.desc: Pudsey The Dog: The Movie is â€˜Babeâ€™ meets â€˜Marley and Meâ€™ - a cheeky and downright hilarious animal adventure for the whole family! Oh and by the wayâ€¦ there are songs too!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Take It to the Bank
programme.desc: The Gloucester captains face a familiar decision: whether or not to take the long, high-Â¬-risk journey to Georges Bank to increase their chances of a big bluefin haul.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Doubling Down
programme.desc: After a massive haul offshore on Georges Bank last week, Captain Dave Carraro of FV-Â¬-Tuna.com and Captain TJ Ott of Hot Tuna decide to double down and make the long trip again.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Riders in the Storm
programme.desc: When a violent storm rolls in during week eleven, the Gloucester captains face a tough decision at a critical time: do they fish... or flee?

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Comeback Kid
programme.desc: With four weeks left in the season, Hard Merchandise and FV-Â¬- Tuna.Com struggle to stay at the top of the fleet as an unexpected adversary, the Wicked Pissah.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Invaders
programme.desc: With only three weeks left, the North Atlantic captains face more competition than ever as boats from all over head to Gloucester and battle for those last bluefin of the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Thin Bluefin Line
programme.desc: There is a narrow margin separating the top four boats and only two weeks left in the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Final Fishdown
programme.desc: In the last week of the Atlantic bluefin tuna season, the closest race in Wicked Tuna history is a tossup among four top contenders.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Bite is On
programme.desc: Meet the fleet, as peak season begins and the adrenaline rush of \\"monstah\\" hunting hits Gloucester.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Payback's a Fish
programme.desc: After going bust on his last trip and coming home empty-handed, Marciano of Hard Merchandise now wrestles with the trials of being a husband and father who has to be away from home so often.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Weekend Warriors
programme.desc: Tuna.com continues its winning streak, catching two fish in one day while the rest of the fleet struggles to even find a spot to fish in between the weekend recreational boaters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Size Matters
programme.desc: Meet Kevin and the Christina, a boat that gets its own real-life fish story when it snags an 1,100-pound \\"monstah\\" right out of the gate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Greed, Ego & Jealousy
programme.desc: After watching the Christina catch the biggest tuna of the season, the uber-competitive Captain Dave of the Tuna.com is obsessed with beating the record, and catching a fish bigger than 1,075 lbs!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mann gegen Sturm
programme.desc: Marciano, captain of Hard Merchandise, risks the elements to hook a giant bluefin and finds himself with boat trouble in the midst of the storm.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mutiny at Sea
programme.desc: A mixture of bad luck and mutiny brews in this tumultuous episode of Wicked Tuna. Tensions erupt on New England's top tuna boat, Tuna.Com, when Captain Dave and Paul get into a heated confrontation that causes Paul to quit!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Grudge Match
programme.desc: With just two weeks left until the end of tuna fishing season, Bounty Hunter gains a new deckhand.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Ralph in Not
programme.desc: A hard season with little money to show has taken its toll on the crew of the Odysea, leading Captain Ralph to lash out at his first mate Pirate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Good to the Last Bite
programme.desc: As the final week of tuna fishing begins, the Hard Merchandise, the Bounty Hunter, the Tuna.Com and the Odysea steam out together, each captain vowing to catch the biggest tuna before the season ends.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Bite is On
programme.desc: Meet the fleet, as peak season begins and the adrenaline rush of \\"monstah\\" hunting hits Gloucester.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Payback's a Fish
programme.desc: After going bust on his last trip and coming home empty-handed, Marciano of Hard Merchandise now wrestles with the trials of being a husband and father who has to be away from home so often.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Weekend Warriors
programme.desc: Tuna.com continues its winning streak, catching two fish in one day while the rest of the fleet struggles to even find a spot to fish in between the weekend recreational boaters.

programme.desc: Recent graduates of a secluded U.S. Air Force base must protect a gene-editing bioweapon from the Russian militaryâ€”who are desperate to seize the deadly viral agent at any cost.

programme.title: Heist
programme.desc: A father is without the means to pay for his daughter's medical treatment. As a last resort, he partners with a greedy co-worker to rob a casino. When things go awry they're forced to hijack a city bus.

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon

programme.desc: A Cambridge University professor (Pierce Brosnan) who meets his match in Kristin (Salma Hayek), and is forced to re-evaluate his life of hedonistic excess after he manages to get her stepsister (Jessica Alba), pregnant.

programme.desc: In a series of sexual mishaps, a high school senior tries to lose her virginity on the last night before graduation.

programme.title: Morris from America
programme.desc: This coming-of-age drama follows 13-year-old Morris as he moves to Heidelberg, Germany with his father and adjusts to his vastly different home.

programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: The first ever movie about becoming a pro skater.

programme.title: Brad's Status
programme.desc: A father takes his son to tour colleges on the East Coast and meets up with an old friend who makes him feel inferior about his life's choices.

programme.desc: After 8 years in prison, inventor Robert Axle struggles to win over his estranged family and catch up on current technology as he works to once again become the king of the infomercial.

programme.title: Morris from America

programme.title: Unleashing Mr. Darcy
programme.desc: Idealistic dog handler Elizabeth Bennett finds herself repeatedly judged in dog show rings by philanthropist Donovan Darcy. What she doesnâ€™t count on is an unstoppable attraction to the billionaire dog breeder.

programme.desc: Personal and career circumstances force big-city radio host Emma to broadcast and web-cast from the home she inherited in rural Washington State.

programme.desc: A career-focused San Francisco divorce attorney whose busy professional life has replaced her desire for romance. When she learns that her widowed Aunt has hastily agreed to marry a charming veteran movie star.

programme.desc: Museum curator, Lily, finds a painting that's identical to her and searches for the artist in Ireland. There, William, a charming man joins her on her quest and helps her rediscover love.

programme.title: Over the Moon in Love
programme.desc: With her match-making business on the verge of closing, Brooklyn finds herself in the unique position to be featured in a magazine, but has to set up the writer with her childhood friend Devin.

programme.title: A Valentine's Match
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a reality TV host, Natalie returns home for Valentine's Day, only to find herself running the town festival's auction with her ex-fiancÃ© thanks to two scheming mothers.

programme.title: Blueprint to the Heart
programme.desc: Interior designer and house flipper trying to save her home improvement show needs to apply her successful 'fixer upper' home buying strategy to her blue collar contractor.

programme.desc: t's just weeks before Christmas when Ellie, gets a call to return home to help her father on the family's poinsettia farm.

programme.desc: When Miranda Chester set off to find information on her biological father two Christmases ago, she never imagined that her investigation would lead her to the family she had always longed for and the love of her life.

programme.desc: Melanie Welch is a hard-working ad executive who finds herself teamed up with uptight coworker Donovan Goodwin to come up with the ultimate Christmas commercial for a new cell phone.

programme.title: A Fabled Holiday
programme.desc: Talia and her childhood best friend Anderson unexpectedly reunite in a familiar looking town full of Christmas spirit that restores its visitors during their times of deep turmoil.

programme.title: Five More Minutes: Moments Like These
programme.desc: Inspired by Scotty McCreery's song 'Five More Minutes', a Christmas wish gets realized in an unexpected way, as a young widow has to return to her old home for the holidays.

programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Chanel and Sterling are joined by none other than Rob's dad, Gene Dyrdek who teaches the gang about THE POWER OF MAGNETS, that it's NEVER TOO LATE and the mysterious GREY GUNNERS.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, rapper Big Baby D.R.A.M. joins Rob, Chanel, and Steelo to get into some BAD BROCCOLI, learn how to speak UNCLISH and fend off a few URBAN PREDATORS.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, rapper Post Malone joins Rob, Chanel, and Steelo to ball with some REALLY WHITE IVERSONS, get messy with the category SAUCIN' ON YOU and show off some KNUCKLE TATS.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On a special episode of Major Key-diculousness, DJ Khaled teaches Rob, Chanel and Sterling how to be GRATEFUL, how to avoid THEY and how to get LOST AT SKI.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On a very special awards show episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Steelo and Chanel give out Ridicky Awards such as "THE BIGGEST DICK", "THE FREEDOM FALCON" and "THE GRAND SLAM" to the stars of some of the greatest clips from the last 10 seasons.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness rapper 21 Savage joins Rob, Chanel and Steelo to go into SAVAGE MODE, update the dictionary with WORD BIRTHERS and prove you never know when a random object ISSA WEAPON.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Chanel and Steelo witness WORLD WAR BEE, diagnose a medical condition known as BACKFLIP BLOCK, and avoid stray tires in THE WHEEL WORLD.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, hip hop and R&B singer Ty Dolla $ign joins Rob, Steelo, and Chanel to check out some SIDE SHOWS, do a little NECK PREP, and find the hottest PORTA-PARTIES.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, hip hop producer and hit maker DJ Mustard joins Rob, Steelo, and Chanel to put MUSTARD ON EVERYTHING, suffer through a COLD SUMMER, and celebrate the greatest HEY MAKERS of all time.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Chanel and Steelo attend some BRO BURIALS, hang with a crew of LIL' TRUNKIES and teach us a new trend called SPEED BUMPING.

programme.title: The Fifth Estate
programme.desc: The top-notch team of hosts Bob McKeown, Gillian Findlay, Mark Kelley and Habiba Nosheen provides unique and engaging documentaries from Canada and beyond. "The Fifth Estate" is a reference to the term Fourth Estate, and was chosen to highlight the program's determination to go beyond everyday news into original journalism. The series has won numerous awards for its reporting, including Gemini Awards, International Emmys, the Michener Award, and even an Academy Award for a 1981 episode that was released in theaters the following year. Since September 1975, Canadians have tuned in to experience interesting stories that are always well-crafted and thought-provoking.

programme.title: Marketplace
programme.desc: Canada's consumer watchdog series since 1972, this news program uncovers wrongdoings in the marketplace. With the help of hidden cameras, correspondents dish out the dirt on not so "clean" business practices. Once they get the evidence they need on tape, they apply pressure on businesses to change policies vis-a-vis the products and services they provide to the public.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers experience many emotionally touching moments on their expeditions while observing their main characters over a longer period of time. A lucky moment for Oliver Goetzl and Ivo NÃ¶renberg in the Yellowstone National Park: When a wolf appears they give up on a lone newborn bison. But at the very last moment, its mother arrives and saves it. On an expedition in the Himalayas, Henry Mix is able to find Bengal tigers. A kangaroo mother even allows Thoralf Grospitz to film its tiny baby in her pouch. But they witness sad moments as well: On the Arctic Wrangel Island, Uwe Anders has to watch a snowy owl mother stop feeding one of her two chicks due to the shortage of food that year. "Big emotions" shows the most touching and the most heart-breaking moments wildlife filmmakers have experienced all over the world.

programme.title: mareTV: Curacao, Blue Wonder of the Caribbean
programme.desc: Curacao is one of the most popular attractions for countless cruise ships on their trips through the Caribbean, because it is located outside of the hurricane belt. This is why Eric Miguel is constantly in action. He is the bridge keeper of the Queen Emma Bridge, the landmark of Curacao's capital, Willemstad. After his shift, Eric goes to Yvonne Troeman's cook-shop. Her speciality is Kadushi, a cactus soup. The ingredients include cactus flesh, pigtail's, mussels and a few secret "treats". Barbara van Bebber is the only submarine pilot on Curacao and literally gets to the bottom of things amidst the turquoise-blue wonder of the Caribbean. She charters out her sub to marine biologists and wealthy private explorers, simultaneously cleaning up on the seabed. Her "Curasub" has claw arms, which she employs to remove anything that doesn't belong down there: beer bottles, car tyres, and plastic refuse. Jeroen Eikelenboom simply carts sand from a neighbouring cove to his own surf club in his favourite bay.

programme.title: mareTV: Mexico's Caribbean Coast
programme.desc: The palm tree laden beaches on Mexico's Riviera Maya on the Yucatan peninsula are endless, and the turquoise sea with its gentle Caribbean surf is a warm 25 degrees during the mild winter in this part of the world. Between CancÃºn and Punta Allen, where once there was little more than bushland and a few sleepy fishing villages, vibrant life has evolved during the past three decades. Richard Sowa has lived on a floating island for the past 15 years: an island he built himself out of empty plastic bottles. The bon vivant him-self sees it as a "solution for our planet's refuse problem". Off Punta Allen, a village in the bay of Sian Ka'an, Mexican Mara Coral Ley and her cousin Kim, continue to catch lobsters by adhering to the traditional method and were awarded an "Eco seal for sustainable fishing" for their trouble. It is silent under water off Isla Mujeres and it is here that the artist Jason deCaires has constructed a sculpture park. Hundreds of lifesize figures form an artificial reef at a depth of 12 metres. Fish and plants complete his work of art. The master himself is convinced: "Mother Nature is the true artist".

programme.title: Caribbean sisters: The Lesser Antilles St. Kitts & Nevis
programme.desc: In the centre of the Caribbean, volcanoes rise steeply from the sea, thus shaping the sister islands of St. Kitts & Nevis. Their slopes, covered in lush rainforests, snow-white, sandy beaches and the surrounding tur-quoise tinted waters provide the ultimate setting for this record-breaking, albeit tiny island paradise: Both islets are the smallest of the Caribbean dwarf states and also rank among the worldâ€™s ten smallest states. A hot pepper sauce, made of a creative mixture of ginger, garlic, thyme and extraordinarily hot chillies that thrive in the hot and humid climate of Nevis, is simmering on the stove of Violet and Llewellynâ€™s house. Lemmy Pemberton digs up abandoned turtle nests with his bare hands, as he wants to be certain that all of the babies have indeed managed to make it. Members of the Turtle Group catch sea turtles in order to take their measurements and fit them with transmitters. Taxi bus-es are not only the main means of transport on St. Kitts & Nevis, they are also an artistic expression of each driverâ€™s personality. Colourfully embellished, each taxi represents island art on wheels.

programme.title: Cuba - Brilliantly Caribbean
programme.desc: Even anyone who has not yet been to Cuba can conjure up certain images of American vintage street cruisers, imposing buildings that have seen better days, white sandy beaches full of palms and loving couples on the MalecÃ³n against a backdrop of crashing waves. This island is somewhat of a myth and its people generate a special joie de vivre. The legendary Hershey Train departs for Matanzas from the capital, Havana. On the oldest electrified railway line in the Caribbean, 60-year-old Spanish carriages make their way along al-most 100 kilometres of coastline in the most relaxed way possible. The Salvavidas on Varadero, probably the most famous beach on the island, have a particular-ly beautiful workplace. The lifeguards' territory ex-tends for more than 20 kilometres. In order to protect the coasts of Cuba, mangroves have been replanted here for many years. The project is supported by the UN and planting is often carried out by schoolchildren. In doing so, Cuban children learn how to treat their maritime habitat in a sustainable fashion. The former colonial city of Trinidad on Cuba's south coast is gen-erally considered to be one of the most beautiful places in the entire Caribbean. The houses here are particular-ly colourful. A plethora of magnificent buildings can be seen at the Plaza Mayor, the neo-baroque main square.

programme.title: mareTV: The Caribbean for explorers: St. Vincent and the Grenadines
programme.desc: Much more Caribbean than on the islands of St. Vincent and the Grenadines is hardly possible. Deserted beaches, uninhabited islands, lush vegetation, the 33 islands in total are dreamlike with extremely hospitable inhabitants. Miranda Phillips runs a laundry and water boat on Bequia. Every morning, the 32-year-old navigates from yacht to yacht with her small bright green service vehicle and is already expected by most skippers. Miranda promises radiantly fresh laundry, which she delivers again the same day. And so there is always something going on in her tiny laundrette in the harbour. It turns into a karaoke bar in the evening, because that is Miranda's great passion. Eban Olliver has many jobs at once. He is the lighthouse keeper of Kingstown. And that means a lot of responsibility in St. Vincent's biggest port city. Because Eban doesn't just change the light bulbs, he's a pilot dispatcher, harbour master and guard all in one person. First contact with ships is particularly important. Once he even saved the entire nation from an Ebola virus.

programme.title: The Heart of Hawaii - The Island of Oahu
programme.desc: The Oahu island is the economic and cultural centre of the Hawaiian archipelago, as well as being a paradise for surfers, active holidaymakers and freedom lovers. The island is home to more than half of all natives and almost eight million foreign guests annually. Anyone searching for peace and seclusion wonâ€™t find either in Honolulu or Waikiki. Traffic congestion and a backdrop of skyscrapers belong to the town panorama. Hip cafes, galleries and young fashion firms have settled here, adding a new and modern flair to the capital. Cindyâ€™s Lei Shoppe, the Chinatown florists, has been here for more than 30 years. This is also because the so-called Leis, the tradition of floral decoration, usually offered as a flower necklace or as a headdress, is still an important part of Hawaiian culture. Keone Nunes is well-known for his traditional tattooing skills, whereby the so-called Kakau Tattoos are virtually hammered into the skin with a hippo tooth. But Oahu is also an island of overwhelming natural beauty and a fascinating diversity on the smallest of places ...

programme.title: The Seychelles - Africa with South Seas ambience
programme.desc: The 115 islands and islets that make up the Seychelles present a breath-taking variety of plants, rare animals and beaches laced with palms. This is where the leg-endary Coco de Mer palm nuts grow with fruits weigh-ing up to 20 kilos and giant wild land turtles nibble away at mangrove fruits to their hearts content. The archipelago was first settled at the end of the 18th cen-tury. Today, a very colourful potpourri of peoples in this dwarf state proves just how peacefully different cultures can live side by side. Three times a week, the steamer "MV Espoir" completes the trip from the main island of MahÃ© to Praslin and back. A ship for every-one and practically everything: Used cars, toilet paper, horses, bicycles, furniture - you name it, the Espoir transports goods of all kinds. Coconuts sometimes pose a problem as there are far too many of them. What to do with them? The best place to send them is undoubt-edly Hubert Roumien's Virgin Coconut Oil Laboratory, hidden away in the MahÃ© jungle. Straw turns into gold at Seaweed Seychelles! There, Benjamin Port Louis collects seaweed and extracts liquid fertiliser from it.

programme.title: Sri Lanka - Tropics, temples and tea plantations
programme.desc: Sri Lanka stands for colourful diversity in all respects. If it's spirituality or Ayurveda you're looking for, here it is. Adventurers and nature lovers can also satisfy their needs here. No one must travel far to discover exotic worlds on this drop-shaped tropical island. "mareTV" delves into the day to day lives of the is-landers, some of whom pursue the most unusual pro-fessions: Uditha Lakmaal is a palm tree climber. He harvests the sap of the trees, known as palm wine, by climbing to the top of them. Sri Lankan stilt fishermen now actually have very little to do with fish and func-tion more as models receiving payment from tourists for acting the part. Anulawathie runs a small floating hoop business, offering car inner tubes for adults and tuk-tuk tubes for children. Different varieties of tea can be found on Herman Gunaratnes tea plantation. Just four carefully selected women are allowed to harvest the exclusive white tea grown there. Each tea leaf is cut individually from the bush by gloved hands and with golden scissors.

programme.title: mareTV: Hong Kong - Metropolis in the sea
programme.desc: Hong Kong translated means "fragrant harbour". The days of the spicy smoking ceremonies have passed, but MareTV has discovered many delightful contrasts between the metropolis and Mother Nature. In for-mer times, the rare eagle wood tree grew here. Its wood put the spice into the Taoist smoking ceremonies. The fragrant harbour: what sounds so charming is today a huge metropolis in the sea. No other tiny piece of land is more densely populated. Star Ferries have been commuting between the Kowloon Peninsula and central Hong Kong for the past 125 years. The British colonial masters are long gone, but on the ancient ferries, virtually nothing has changed. Most of the ships are still clad in British Racing Green and the crew still wears the old, decorative uniforms.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Zanzibar
programme.desc: Photographer Matthias Ziegler is an Africa specialist. He has visited nearly every country on the continent on assignments for international agencies. Zanzibar, however, is new territory for him. He's come to the former slave island for a photo book â€“ and this time he's not alone. To see the Tanzanian archipelago from the air, he has enlisted the services of ultralight pilot Richard Meredith-Hardy of England to fly him around in his FIB, or flying inflatable boat. Perfect conditions for an adventurous journey: as a world champion ultralight pilot, Richard and his FIB can take off and land practically anywhere â€“ in theory.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Mauritius
programme.desc: Renaud Van Der Meeren is a photographer and paramotor pilot. With his motorised parachute he goes on expeditions to the remotest corners on earth to photograph people and landscapes from the air. Renaud wanted to be a jet pilot, studied music at the Sorbonne, became a ski instructor, model and photographer's assistant before he found happiness in his current vocation. He especially likes to do his job in Mauritius â€“ nowhere else does he find so many motifs as on the "sweetest pearl in the Indian Ocean". This time he's working on a photo book about Mauritius â€“ by land, by water and in the air.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Madagascar
programme.desc: Spirits, Kings, Lemurs â€“ Madagascar treats Ami to a multitude of new impressions and spectacular pictures. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied her on her trip.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Sao Tome and Principe
programme.desc: Along with photographer Rui Camilo, we travel to the West African island nation of Sao TomÃ© and PrÃ­ncipe - in search of images that will capture the soul of this small and beautiful country.

programme.title: Over the Islands of Africa
programme.sub-title: Over the Islands of Africa, Cape Verde
programme.desc: Cape Verde â€“ the islands of Saudade, of longing. For StÃ©phane and Richard it was a journey full of adventure, unforgettable encounters and magnificent photographs. Director Christian Schidlowski and his team accompanied them on their trip.

programme.title: mareTV: Martinique
programme.desc: The island of Martinique is a piece of France in the Caribbean, between Florida and South America. And of course, Savoir-vivre applies just as it does on the other side of the Atlantic, between the English Channel and the Mediterranean. Jacky Pascault is the first and only man to cultivate mushrooms in the Caribbean. Everywhere else, they grow on artificially fertilised soil, but Jacky's Champignons Tropicaux flourish on sugar cane fibres. Nicole Vilo tailors hats and dresses out of coconut palms. Of course, the catwalk for the models wearing her first collection is one of the countless dream beaches. The Martiniquais sail on boats they call Yole, which have no keel and are therefore difficult to navigate. The crew members hang over the water in breakneck fashion on long wooden poles. Just the job for Yole-boss Max' "problem kids": they not only learn complicated handling, but also team spirit.

programme.desc: Some of the cutest mini-monsters can grow to be the most ferocious predators.
